basics.name: Multi-Skilled Engineering Manager
basics.summary: An experienced Engineering Manager who's skilled in a multitude of areas including leadership, project management, software engineering, and more. Adept at leading teams in the development of hardware systems to support various industries including military, space, and commercial flight simulators

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Manager of a team of electrical and mechanical engineers responsible for the design and development of high fidelity training devices. Also leads multiple initiatives with a goal of continuous improvement which includes staffing projects, developing project schedules, managing communications between multiple teams, etc.
highlights: Selected to participate in Boeing's Systems Engineering Leadership Program
Recognized as a Technical Lead Engineer
Managed to implement a thirty-five percent reduction in the electrical engineering cost estimating relationship

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Led electrical engineering for the design, development, manufacturing, and delivery of numerous flight simulators for various clients including the US Air Force.
highlights: Initiated the lean practice of performing hardware checkout in the final phase of manufacturing
Managed to save three weeks per flight simulator schedule
Supervised the installation of numerous flight simulators throughout the United States, United Kingdom, and South Korea

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Designed electrical systems to be integrated in military flight simulators and developed design specifications, schematics, and assembly drawings for the manufacturing of the simulators
highlights: Played an integral part in the production of the first high fidelity F-15 flight simulator
Initiated a trade study to utilize commercially available uninterruptible power supplies resulting in a cost savings of $150,000 per training facility

volunteer.summary: Coordinator and coach for youth sports events
